column1: Art Institute of Chicago////My last visit I was with my husband and a group of his friends (ok
column2: not real art types....) and I was being rushed as the guys were getting anxious to get to our next stop.  So to maximize my time (ok
column3: I'm not the best with directions and I get lost easily) my husband suggested I talk to a security guard that was working there and ask her where the things I was interested in were.  I was skeptical that this would work
column4: but I was amazed at how helpful and patient she was with me.  She totally made my day
column5: I was slightly irriated about being rushed through such a great place and she understood and helped me see more that I thought I would in my short amount of time.  She knew where everything was
column6: got us there quickly and even provided us with commentary!  It ended up being the best museum trip ever.
